newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanese pound edges down on week.
newsitem.headline: Lebanese pound edges down on week.

text.p: The Lebanese pound traded at the upper end of the central bank's bid-offer intervention band in the week ended on Thursday amid continued demand for U.S. dollars on the Beirut foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The inter-bank trading of the dollar was in a range of 1541.00-1541.50 Lebanese pounds against last week's range of 1,535.00-1,541.50, dealers said.
The Bank of Lebanon's bid-offer intervention band was 1,532.00-1,541.00 Lebanese pounds compared to last week's 1,532.50-1,541.50, continuing the official policy of a slight pound appreciation.
Investors who did not renew subscription in Lebanese-pound-denominated treasury bills shifted to dollars, said a dealer, who asked not to be identified.
"Demand for dollars was much higher than offer, which was very light because some matured treasury bills were not renewed," he added.
Banks and financial markets will close on Friday for the Assumption day holiday.
